result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Ann Waggoner-Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sawyer County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: $ 2072.00  Forfeiture/costs/DNA.  Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
230 Days County Jail w/Huber, credit for 5 days time served
27 months, 230 days   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.
27 months efective 7/29/16 on any vehicle owned or operated.

OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.   Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.

judgments.dispoDesc: 230 days Sawyer County Jail beginning today with Huber privleges and credit for 5 days time served; Fine/costs of $ 2072.00, pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee. Restitution in the amount of $ 24.25 to Sawyer County S.O. for blood draw. DL revoked for 27 mo plus 230 days.  DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence. IID required for 27 mo  on any vehicle owned or operated, effective 7/29/2016.    OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.   Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.   Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa Ann Waggoner-Roberts

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lisa Ann Waggoner-Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth Jean Smith.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts
PLQ given to court.  DEF pleads guilty
Court accepts plea, finds guilty.
11:11 Off record: Atty and ADA in chambers
11:16 On- Parties argue sentence.
Court imposes: 230 days county jail beginning today, credit for 5 days, time served. Costs/forfeiture of $ 2072.00 plus costs of 24.25 to S.O. for blood draw. Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
DL revoked for 27 months plus 230 days   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.
IID required for 27 months effective 7/29/16  On any vehicle owned or operated.   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.
  Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.   Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge. 
Atty Smith requests bond to be returned and DEF allowed to set up payplan.
Court denies request. Bond to be applied to costs/forfeiture.
Parties request to remove the 03/08/16 Preliminary Hearing from the Court's calendar and reschedule for a plea/sentencing hearing in June.  New hearing set for 06/14/16.

Defendant Lisa Ann Waggoner-Roberts in court with attorney Joseph Schieffer (for Elizabeth Smith).  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.   Bond Continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lisa Ann Waggoner-Roberts
Current: 181 2nd Avenue   - Apt. B3, Minong, WI 54859   (Effective: 01-28-2016)
Prior: 181 2nd Street   - Apt. B3, Minong, WI 54859
DEF shall report to SC DHHS within 48 hrs upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to learn of STOP program. Must not posess any aerosol cans.

Cash bond set at $1000.00,   No aerosol cans in possession.
